alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 01 at 12:44PM EST until December 01 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou Maine has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Aroostook County in northern Maine... Northern Penobscot County in east central Maine... * Until 130 PM EST. * At 1243 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located 8 miles north of Mount Chase, or 14 miles north of Patten, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 275 and 304. US Highway 1 between North Amity and Monticello. State Highway 11 near Knowles Corner. Locations impacted include... Houlton, Hodgdon, Island Falls, Smyrna, Amity, Mount Chase, Dudley Township, Cary Plantation, Shin Pond, Smyrna Mills, Littleton, Linneus, Monticello, Oakfield, New Limerick, Ludlow, Merrill, Crystal, Cary and Dyer Brook. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
